intro: Mendoncia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy mendoncia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Mendoncia pilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils.
